title: Observability â€” What changed and why it mattered
summary: Standardized traces/metrics and cleaned up alerts so fixing things got faster and alerts got quieter.

steps.label: Context
steps.body: Incidents took too long to resolve. The alerts were noisy and overwhelming. On top of that, teams lacked a common view across their services.

steps.label: Goals
steps.body: Accelerate issue detection, reduce alert fatigue, and establish clear SLOs to define success.

steps.label: What I changed
steps.body: I drove a major reliability initiative by implementing OpenTelemetry for unified observability, building Prometheus and Grafana dashboards for real-time insights, establishing SLOs with runbooks for proactive response, and improving deployment hygiene to ensure safer, predictable releases.

steps.label: Results
steps.body: We successfully reduced p95 latency for a faster user experience and cut alert noise in half. Most importantly, we improved our MTTR even as traffic continued to grow, demonstrating a more resilient and stable system.
